descriptionHtml:
Leave that fancy elven stuff to the elves, and leave steel to the Sheriff's men.  
What you need is good home-tanned leather.
This simple non-replacing plug-in is intended to support role-playing
as a yeoman archer or scruffy Sherwood Forest outlaw.  The archer's
leather armor and wooden bows are designed to look home-made.
I've made both archer's leather armor and yew longbow depend on
the Steel Smithing perk; they should be fully temperable, so that
there'll be less need to abandon leather and wood at higher levels.
No existing objects are replaced.
All equipment in this plug-in uses and requires the Steel Smithing perk.
Once you have this perk you'll find the the archer's leather cap, bracers, 
leather jacket and boots listed at any forge under leather.  You'll find 
yew longbows under wood and Nord arrows under "miscellaneous."  
With more Smithing experience, Yeoman and Dragonslayer arrows 
and longbows can be crafted working from the Arcane Blacksmith 
and Dragon Armor perks.
Installation:  drop the YeomanArcher.esp file into the Skyrim Data folder,
then enable it.  If you use Nexus Mod Manager, find the plug-in tab
and check the box next to YeomanArcher.  If you are using the basic
main game launcher, select "Data" and double-click your plugin.
Uninstall:  save your game and delete the plug-in.
Other mods:
No new meshes or textures are added, and no original files are overwritten,
so I would expect this plug-in to be broadly compatible with other mods.
For a melee weapon, consider JZBai's Quarterstaff mod from Skyrim Nexus:
  http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25431/?
Sessine's Better Shaped Longbows .nif is also useful:
  http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25431/?
More prosperous outlaws might like Atomec's Rough Leather Armor mod:
  http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54672/?
Please let me know if any part of this plug-in doesn't work.
Thank you!
author: blueboar
